replies.commentBody:
What would you have a special prosecutor investigate? There is no evidence that anyone committed any crime. The intelligence agencies and Congress have seen transcripts of Michael Flynn's calls with the Russian ambassador, and they were fine. No one else did anything.

It's clear that the Russians meddled in our election. That is something that a special prosecutor would have nothing to do with. And that's all there is.
Republicans, all together now, in lock step, right left, right left...

comments.commentBody: WHAT DOES IT TAKE to get the Special Prosecutor and investigation underway? The Republicans, ALL OF THEM, voted not to investigate!

replies.commentBody: What a joke! Bill and Hill were up to their eyeballs in foreign influence peddling.

comments.commentBody: What is so incredibly sad - and treasonous - is that the Republican establishment is so hell-bent on power and tax breaks for the wealthy that they are willing to allow our democracy to be subverted by our enemy the Russians.  Where are the statesmen (or stateswomen) on the Republican side of the aisle?  Where are their voices for an independent, bipartisan commission to investigate?  The time is NOW!

"Judge not the play until the play is over."

Just when I was beginning to worry that this investigation into the Trump campaign colluding with Russia was fading away, Obama's team restores my faith. Let's hope all is brought to light, whatever it may be, for the sake of preserving our free democracy.

replies.commentBody: The truth will set us free continue to investigate the truth!  We are the United States of America not Trump's America!

The Trump administration and campaign team smells to high heaven and it's time for a special prosecutor, subpoena all of Trump's tax returns and investments for the last 20 years, and put everyone of these clowns under oath, this cannot go unpunished.

comments.commentBody:
"the Obama administration have sought to create a false narrative to make an excuse for their own defeat in the election" ... it may come as a surprise to Trump, but Obama wasn't running.

No one knows how much of this is true. That's why you investigate, and given the stakes, investigate thoroughly. The only reason to oppose an investigation is out of fear of the results.

replies.commentBody: I can't support Obama manipulating elections in Israel, Egypt, etc.

comments.commentBody:
Foreign and domestic intelligence agencies have recorded and detailed the interactions between the Trump campaign and the Russians prior to the election.

Trump's campaign manager Paul Manafort and his National Security Advisor Michael Flynn both resigned as a result of cash payments and/or contact with the Russians promising the end of economic sanctions and pro-Russian, anti-NATO positions endorsed by President Trump.

In exchange, the Kremlin hacked the DNC and Hillary Clinton's campaign manager John Podesta. Trump applauded WikiLeaks and publicly asked for Russian help with his campaign.

Putin also orchestrated a disinformation campaign that not only changed crucial votes in battleground states, but led one North Carolina man into a Washington DC pizzeria firing an assault rifle over fake stories that Hillary Clinton was kidnapping, molesting and trafficking children.

Did it change the US election results?

Clinton won the popular vote by 3 million votes, but Trump won by a narrow margin of 100,000 votes in key battleground states that gave him an Electoral College win.

Republicans in Congress have a better understanding of all the intelligence and probably plan to let eventually Trump go in favor of VP Mike Pence, who is in lock-step with Speaker Ryan and Senate Majority Leader McConnell.

It doesn't matter which party you belong to. If you are an American, you can't support Russia manipulating the US Presidential election.

We have been reading about Trump's connections with Russians since October.  It has been six months now since ABC reported payments coming from Russia to Trump.   Harry Reid stated then that there was information that the FBI had that should be made public.  How much longer will it take for these intelligence committees to verify what the news organizations have been telling us for months?  How much more of a smoking gun do they need then  Trump covering for Flynn's lies about his phone calls for two weeks, which by all accounts would have been longer, if it hadn't been leaked?

Oh My... So there was contact between Russians and Americans in the 2016 election run up .
Who? Trump associates? Were any of them involved in the Election Campaign?
You don't suppose some of all those meetings in Europe had anything to do with the Trump campaign?
Of course not - that would be an alternative narrative - or; fake news that wasn't approved......

I am anticipating that the learned and skillful Obama will incorporate the general details of this subject in summary in his new book that I will most definitely grab the day it is published. He can outline and interconnect what he knows in vague terms so as not to compromise state secrets. An Ebook will be on all my readers, but I will most definitely want a durable long lasting hard copy.

The Republican congresspersons who are  trying to downplay this investigation must realize that America's allies have much of this intelligence. If or when this blows up, their complicity in the coverup will be exposed.
We need a full and independent investigation immediately. If this goes all the way to the top, as seems incredibly likely, impeach him now.

I fully expected American intelligence to give the Obama administration a suitable retaliatory file, which would then be flipped over to some web sight much like WikiLeaks.  it didn't happen.  that tells me American intelligence has not broken into Russian computers.  This article is more of the same.  Nothing. So sad.

replies.commentBody:
Sounds great -- but that would be an ex post facto law* which is unconstitutional.
*ex post facto law definition. A law that makes illegal an act that was legal when committed, increases the penalties for an infraction after it has been committed, or changes the rules of evidence to make conviction easier. The Constitution prohibits the making of ex post facto law. http://www.dictionary.com/browse/ex-post-facto-law

comments.commentBody: Congress could draft and pass a piece of legislation in a week making the tradition of presidential candidates revealing their tax returns a law requiring them too  -- retroactive to the current president.  Then the news media starts putting microphones in front of every republican congressman who opposes this new law until the public outrage gets the law passed.  Then the Russian connection will be exposed...

replies.commentBody: I think it is irresponsible to start blaming Obama for an extremely complex issue.  Put the brakes on here.

comments.commentBody: Thanks, Obama.  Seriously.

replies.commentBody: It is important because Trump was running for President and he was publicly aligning himself with Putin a known adversary of America in order to win.  The president cannot be a person who is compromised in his capacity to serve as commander-in-chief.  All the evidence so far clearly points to the Russians having influence on Trump.   There is a reason why Trump *refused* to allow the kind of extreme vetting of his past that was customary for all GOP candidates seeking the party's nomination.  He is as dirty as New York snow and he knows such an investigation would have immediately shot down his chances.  My guess is that he is so dirty the CIA itself will take him out without waiting for a congressional impeachment that will never come.
keep trying - if all of this was above board - then why do people in the trump administration lie about it?
The Russians hacked into our elections! .. doesn't that bother you??

comments.commentBody: Most Americans don't  like Russia much.  And they don't read much either. So why should anyone be concerned about what Putin and Russia says through their mouthpieces like RT? Americans  watch TV. So how did Russia manage to influence Americans? How many people read Wikileaks  Podesta emails that  Assange has operated for years now? How do we know the NY Times in its articles on Uranimum One wasn't more effective in influencing Americans than the Russians?  And so what if Trump campaign people talked with Russians?  For years American businesspersons like Rex Tillerson have talked to Russians and done business deals with Russians including Hillary's own husband.  That in itself means nothing.  Neither Trump nor his campaign officials had national security or intelligence information to leak to Russia. So what makes them so dangerous?  They were all businesspersons like George Soros who invested one of his funds in Russian silver in the 1990's and made a fortune.  Trump deals in real estate. And before 2014, there were a lot of American businesses talking to Russians about oil and natural gas deals.

Why did the, now, attorney general of the US, Jeff Sessions lie about his contacts with the Russian ambassador?

He responded with a categorical "No" to a written question posed to him during the confirmation process.

Is that not perjury?

We need an independent commission to investigate ties between Trump campaign (of which the AG was a part) and Russia.

No pronouncements of guilty or innocent just yet - only an independent investigation. The country deserves this at the earliest.
As Carville might put it, "It's the Russia, Stupid!"

replies.commentBody:
Just like everyone else here, your facts don't line up.
What affect on the vote counting at individual precincts did Russia affect?
If Russia could have had any affect, why did Hillary Clinton win the popular vote?
Remember, it was people outside the beltway who elected Mr. Trump. A majority of which don't read this newspaper or watch the mainstream news channels. If a tree falls in a forest..., do you think they'll really care? He now has the bully pulpit and all he has to do is what he's done in his short time in office, keep his promises to his electors. The democrats have allowed the Trojan Horse of state, local and municipal elections to carry the day. The democrats can yell and posture as much as they want to, but they do not and will not have the votes to stop legislation or impeach anyone, anytime in the near future. All this hero worship and fawning over the previous office holder and his supposed heir left no one minding the store or preparing for the eventuality that they'd come up empty. I still giggle at that. One last clarification.
In 1972, Nixon was in the final year of his 1st term (41 months). So in actuality it was 67 months for Nixon to fail. Missed being clever by this much.

Let us know about this "traitorous act" you speak of.
You don't have evidence of traitorous acts, nor does the FBI.
Get over it, Dems, you lost. But keep playing this hand. America hates you
more and more every day.

comments.commentBody:
The Watergate break-in took place on June 17, 1972.

About two years and two months later President Richard Nixon resigned on August 9, 1974.

Two years and two months.
The press did its job and people on the inside of government gave information about a President they deeply disliked and mistrusted. It led to Nixon's downfall.

Trump has alienated the guys and gals with the goods.
The intelligence community.
They will have their knives out for a man who they dislike; a man who has committed a traitorous act with an avowed enemy. Information will keep coming out. This is at the beginning. It's why Trump and his people are so adamant in their ineffective denials.

As the story unfolds, Trump's henchmen will jump ship to save themselves. They'll cut deals and give up their captain.

And, as the scandal grows, the public will choke on it; the Democrats will take the House of Representatives and then the investigation will break the dam.

Twenty six months for Nixon to fall.

The clock has already started on Trump.

Something just doesn't smell right:
- The top National Security Advisor who is a closely trusted associate of Trump from the campaign start was proven to collude with Putin's spies. Pretty damning and treasonous.
- There is evidence that numerous Trump associates have been in frequent contact with Putin's spies.
- Trump does not (or cannot) say anything close to negative about Putin's activities - in fact only positive messages - despite clear public international records of negative activities.
- In my lifetime there has never been so much proof and suspicion of collusion with Putin/Russian spies in a presidential election or the president's associates or the American president himself.
- Treason is something we have to consider given these facts and observations. Let our democratic institutions (FBI, CIA, intelligence committees) get to the bottom of this!

This is overwhelming.

In fact, this is treason.

replies.commentBody: Tom Clancy specialized in fiction  Fitting your reference to him.

comments.commentBody: Many commenters have asked, even pleaded with those loyal Americans who have evidence of Trump's unlawful actions to begin leaking it. It does't take a Tom Clancy to understand that these Americans exist -- they are out there. I have to believe at this point that those who do have proof are quite afraid for themselves and their families if they allow the evidence they possess to be leaked. What possible avenues might be pursued to ensure their safety? Unless we obtain the quality of evidence available during Watergate (which I recall quite well), nothing will come of the "fake hearings" the Republicans claim they will hold.

We have to rush to preserve the intelligence of Russian election hacking and to keep our focus on this clear and present danger to our democracy. The "enemy of the people" is not our independent press, but those who have colluded with foreign powers to undermine our elections.
We must not daily erase our history and use double-think to legitimize Trump's presidency when the entire nation heard him say openly to Vladimir Putin to hack into Hillary Clinton's email server. This was a brazen invitation by Trump to impact the election, which Svengali Putin, the snake charmer, managed to do right under our noses. However, Paul Ryan and Mike Pence proudly nod at every pronouncement that Trump makes, making them Putin's puppets as well as Mitch McConnell, Steve Bannon et al.
Until the Russian connections to the Trump presidency are fully and independently investigated, the country will not be safe and something will remain rotten in the state of the union.

Where is the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff quote? No one in the press has asked the CJCS for his military opinion [or 5Ws] to a strategic-level cyber attack. Cyber is a maneuver medium like land, sea, air, & space. None of the DNC members of Congress have asked the CJCS to testify. CJCS cannot say no to testifying and cannot be restricted from testifying. I was hoping to see the NYT help tell us what the A-Political Senior Military Advisor to the Legislative & Executive branch  has to [specifically] say.  Second question not asked. Was the alleged hack a criminal act or an act of war?

The short term problem is surmountable for the Trump administration, but the long term problem will just grow, and any attempt by the Trump administration to mitigate the problem will just increase their exposure.  If they survive this will be a miracle.  The counter intelligence professionals have drawn their conclusions, intelligence is not about rules of evidence in a Court room, its drawing conclusions from disparate pieces of information.  There was no hard evidence that Osama was in that house in Pakistan, there was inference and conjecture.  What ever was going on with the Trump Campaign and Russian intelligence was/is nefarious, the degree of nefarious is irrelevant, the goose is cooked.  We are all hoping that what we surmise can't be true, are there any innocuous explanation for the Trump campaign  behaviors vis a vis Russia, lets hear one? quickly.  The whirlwind is here.

It's not the crime that gets you ~ it is always the cover up.

Having said that, I suspect when all has been said and done, the naivete and arrogance of this administration will have been put on full display for all the world to see.

So far, the powers that be have held at bay all of the investigations and more importantly, all of the documents required to connect the dots, but 4 years is an awfully long time.

I don't think they make it that far.
comments.userLocation: This is what you voted for people (at least a minority of you)

comments.commentBody:
Let's talk to Senator Cardin and see what his 'secret' dossier from the State Dept. contains before he goes underground like Christopher Steele did.

What would be the precedent to allow President Obama to talk on the record to the NYT? Could a court order a grand jury and get the investigation out of Congress?

If five healthy Russian diplomats are having mysterious heart attacks around the world, someone needs to follow that investigative lead.

And yes, the Cypress bank connection does explain alot about Wilbur Ross's appointment and where DJT has been getting his money. Remember, there is a video out there with Trump Jr. stating that lots of money was flowing towards Trump Enterprises from Russia.
